required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 3 Efficacy and Safety Study of Peginterferon Lambda-1a and Ribavirin With Telaprevir
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Blinded Randomized Study of Peginterferon Lambda-1a and Ribavirin Compared to Peginterferon Alfa-2a and Ribavirin, Each Administered With Telaprevir in Subjects With Genotype-1 Chronic Hepatitis C Who Are Treatment-naive or Relapsed on Prior Treatment With Peginterferon Alfa-2a and Ribavirin

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Peginterferon Lambda-1a (Lambda) combined with Ribavirin (RBV) and Telaprevir (TVR) is effective in the treatment of chronic Hepatitis C (CHC) compared to Peginterferon Alfa-2a (alfa-2a) combined with RBV and Telaprevir.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Extended Rapid Virologic Response (eRVR) - Part A
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at Week 4 and Week 12, week 12 reported
primary_outcome.description: eRVR was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below the lower limit of quantitation, target not detected at Weeks 4 and 12 of treatment. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (lower limit of quantitation =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12) - Part B
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below lower limit of quantitation, target detected or not detected at Week 12 of post-treatment follow-up. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (lower limit of quantitation =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Drug Related AEs, Discontinuation Due to AEs, Dose Reductions and Death - Part A
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of treatment up to Week 48
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered an investigational (medicinal product. An SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose resulted in death, was life-threatening, required inpatient hospitalization or caused prolongation of existing hospitalization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12) - Part A
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ), target detected or not detected at Week 12 of post-treatment follow-up. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (LLOQ =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-Up Week 24 (SVR24) - Part A
secondary_outcome.description: SVR24 was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ), target detected or not detected at Week 24 of post-treatment follow-up. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (LLOQ) =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL). The analysis was performed using Modified Intent-to-Treat method defined as the proportions of participants meeting the response criteria in numerator and denominator based on all treated participants. The analysis was performed in all treated participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Treatment-Naïve Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12) - Part B
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below lower limit of quantitation, target detected or not detected at Week 12 of post-treatment follow-up. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (lower limit of quantitation =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment Emergent Cytopenic Abnormalities - Part B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Day 1 of treatment up to Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Cytopenic abnormalities included anemia defined as hemoglobin <10 grams/decilitre; neutropenia defined as Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) <750 cubic millimetre (mm^3); thrombocytopenia defined as platelets <50,000 mm^3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Extended Rapid Virologic Response (eRVR) - Part B
secondary_outcome.description: eRVR was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below the lower limit of quantitation, target not detected at Weeks 4 and 12 of treatment. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (lower limit of quantitation =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With On-Treatment Flu-Like Symptoms And Musculoskeletal Symptoms- Part B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Day 1 of treatment up to Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Flu-like symptoms included pyrexia, chills, and pain. Musculoskeletal symptoms included arthralgia, myalgia, and back pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow- upWeek 24 (SVR24) - Part B
secondary_outcome.description: SVR24 was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ), target detected or not detected at Week 24 of post-treatment follow-up. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (LLOQ) =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Day 1 of treatment up to Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: All skin reactions involving rash or rash-like events that occurred on treatment were reported.

Part B (Arm 1): Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR
Part B (Arm 2): Peginterferon Lambda-2a + RBV + TVR

Part B (Arm 1): Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR

intervention.arm_group_label: Part B (Arm 2): Peginterferon Lambda-2a + RBV + TVR

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 1000 or 1200 mg based on weight, twice daily, 24 or 48 weeks depending on response
intervention.arm_group_label: Part A: Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR
Part B (Arm 1): Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR
Part B (Arm 2): Peginterferon Lambda-2a + RBV + TVR

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 750 mg, three times a day, 12 weeks only
intervention.arm_group_label: Part A: Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR
Part B (Arm 1): Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR
Part B (Arm 2): Peginterferon Lambda-2a + RBV + TVR

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com.
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic hepatitis C genotype 1. GT-1b Capped at 50 % of naïve subjects
- Naives to prior anti-HCV therapy [Interferon (IFN) and direct antiviral agent (DAA) based]
- Relapsers (defined as subjects who had undetectable HCV ribonucleic acid (RNA) on prior treatment regimen of alfa-2a/RBV and Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA > 25IU/mL after discontinuation of treatment). Capped at 20%
- HCV RNA ≥ 100,000 IU/mL
- Subjects with compensated cirrhosis can be enrolled and will be capped at approximately 10%
- Seronegative for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg)
- Men or women, 18-70 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic liver disease due to causes other than chronic HCV
- Current or past evidence of decompensation
- Conditions that preclude the use of Alfa/RBV/TVR per respective labels
- Diagnosed or suspected hepatocellular carcinoma

facility.name: The University Of Alabama Of Birmingham
Va Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System
University Of California, San Francisco/Sf General Hospital
Bon Secours St. Mary'S Hospital Of Richmond, Inc.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of 881 participants who were enrolled, 648 were randomized and only 644 were treated. 27 participants were treated in Part A and 617 participants were treated in Part B of the study.

group.title: Part A: Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR (Open Label)
group.description: Participants with genotype (GT) -1 chronic Hepatitis C virus infection received Peginterferon Lambda-1a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks. Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

group.title: Part B: Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR
group.description: Participants who were either treatment naive or who were relapsers to previous Peginterferon alfa- 2a/ribavirin treatment received Peginterferon Lambda-1a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks. Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

group.title: Part B: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + RBV + TVR
group.description: Participants who were either treatment naive or who were relapsers to previous Peginterferon alfa- 2a/ribavirin treatment received Peginterferon alfa-2a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks. Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

participants_list.participants: Includes 10 participants who re-joined from treatment period to follow-up period.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority of Lambda/RBV/TVR to Alfa/RBV/TVR was not established because the lower limit of the 95% CI was less than the predefined non-inferiority margin of -12%. As a result, key secondary endpoints were not tested hierarchically to compare treatment groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: Non-inferiority testing is based on lower limit of confidence interval.

An SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose resulted in death, was life-threatening, required inpatient hospitalization or caused prolongation of existing hospitalization.

group.description: Participants were followed up for 48 weeks who received treatment as: Peginterferon Lambda-1a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks.

outcome.population: Analysis was performed using Observed value method, defined as proportions of participants meeting response criteria in numerator and denominator - all treated participants with HCV RNA measured at follow-up Week 24. Analysis was performed in all treated participants with HCV RNA measured at follow-up Week 24 due to early study termination.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Extended Rapid Virologic Response (eRVR) - Part B
measure.description: eRVR was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below the lower limit of quantitation, target not detected at Weeks 4 and 12 of treatment. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (lower limit of quantitation =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).
measure.population: The analysis was performed using Modified Intent-to-Treat method defined as the proportions of participants meeting the response criteria in numerator and denominator based on all treated participants. The analysis was performed in all treated participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With On-Treatment Flu-Like Symptoms And Musculoskeletal Symptoms- Part B
outcome.description: Flu-like symptoms included pyrexia, chills, and pain. Musculoskeletal symptoms included arthralgia, myalgia, and back pain.
outcome.time_frame: After Day 1 of treatment up to Week 48
outcome.population: The analysis was performed using Modified Intent-to-Treat method defined as the proportions of participants meeting the response criteria in numerator and denominator based on all treated participants. The analysis was performed in all treated participants.

group.title: Part B: Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR
group.description: Participants who were either treatment naive or who were relapsers to previous Peginterferon alfa- 2a/ribavirin treatment received Peginterferon Lambda-1a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks. Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

group.title: Part B: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + RBV + TVR
group.description: Participants who were either treatment naive or who were relapsers to previous Peginterferon alfa- 2a/ribavirin treatment received Peginterferon alfa-2a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks. Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With On-Treatment Flu-Like Symptoms And Musculoskeletal Symptoms- Part B
measure.description: Flu-like symptoms included pyrexia, chills, and pain. Musculoskeletal symptoms included arthralgia, myalgia, and back pain.
measure.population: The analysis was performed using Modified Intent-to-Treat method defined as the proportions of participants meeting the response criteria in numerator and denominator based on all treated participants. The analysis was performed in all treated participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow- upWeek 24 (SVR24) - Part B
outcome.description: SVR24 was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ), target detected or not detected at Week 24 of post-treatment follow-up. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (LLOQ) =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).
outcome.population: Analysis was performed using Observed value method, defined as proportions of participants meeting response criteria in numerator and denominator - all treated participants with HCV RNA measured at follow-up Week 24. Analysis was performed in all treated participants with HCV RNA measured at follow-up Week 24 due to early study termination.

group.title: Part B: Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR
group.description: Participants who were either treatment naive or who were relapsers to previous Peginterferon alfa- 2a/ribavirin treatment received Peginterferon Lambda-1a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks. Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

group.title: Part B: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + RBV + TVR
group.description: Participants who were either treatment naive or who were relapsers to previous Peginterferon alfa- 2a/ribavirin treatment received Peginterferon alfa-2a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks. Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow- upWeek 24 (SVR24) - Part B
measure.description: SVR24 was defined as Hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA level below lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ), target detected or not detected at Week 24 of post-treatment follow-up. HCV RNA level was measured using the Roche COBAS® TaqMan HCV Test v.2.0 (LLOQ) =25 IU/mL; limit of detection ~ 10 IU/mL).
measure.population: Analysis was performed using Observed value method, defined as proportions of participants meeting response criteria in numerator and denominator - all treated participants with HCV RNA measured at follow-up Week 24. Analysis was performed in all treated participants with HCV RNA measured at follow-up Week 24 due to early study termination.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Rash
outcome.description: All skin reactions involving rash or rash-like events that occurred on treatment were reported.
outcome.time_frame: After Day 1 of treatment up to Week 48
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in all treated participants.

group.title: Part A: Peginterferon Lambda-1a + RBV + TVR (Open Label)
group.description: Participants with genotype (GT) -1 chronic Hepatitis C virus infection received Peginterferon Lambda-1a 180 mcg subcutaneously, once weekly for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the extended rapid virologic response (eRVR); Ribavirin 1000 or 1200 mg (based on weight) tablets, orally daily in 2 divided doses for 24 or 48 weeks depending on the eRVR response; Telaprevir 750 mg tablets, orally three times a day for 12 weeks. Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

Participants were followed-up for 48 weeks after treatment period.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
